item.title: City Green Live: Moon Taxi
item.description: Nashville based indie alt-rock band Moon Taxi is back with tracks ranging from rock to synth to pop to bluegrass, delivered with a polished, classic sound. The band freed themselves from the barriers of genre and self-definition, and their sixth album, Set Yourself Free, showcases the skill of a fully developed and practiced group of musicians without boundaries.

item.title: Lantern Parade - Workshops
item.description:
Create a Lantern Puppet

Join parade artist Chantelle Rytter as she leads Lantern Workshops - Learn how to create your very own "Everybody Lantern Puppet!" 

Itâ€™s your design. Your lantern puppet could be an animal, character, or an original creature. Think of them as a fantastical second self, a playful critter native to the world of the lantern parade!

Best for older kids & adults - Lantern puppets are easy to create; they can be as simple or elaborate as you'd like. Kids must be accompanied by an adult at all times, and this project is best for ages capable of using scissors and respecting hot glue.

Tickets are $25 per lantern puppet, and all materials are provided. This is a great project for two people. 

Workshops are hosted at Sandy Springs Performing Arts Center (1 Galambos Way, Sandy Springs GA):

âœ¨ Saturday, March 29 at 10:30 AM

âœ¨ Saturday, March 29 at 2:30 PM

ðŸŒŸ Sunday, March 30 at 2:30 PM

 

 

Create a 20th Anniversary Lantern

It is the City of Sandy Springs 20th Anniversary! The idea for flying pigs started with Sandy Springsâ€™ effort to incorporate in 2005, when some believed that Sandy Springs would become a city â€œwhen pigs fly.â€ If you make this lantern, you get to march in the front of the Lantern Parade with Sanderson the Flying Pig!

Join parade artist Chantelle Rytter as she leads Lantern Workshops - Learn how to create your very own "20th Anniversary Lantern!" 

Open to artists of all ages. This is a great for anyone who likes to color! This lantern is made of an 11 x 17 drawing to color with markers. The assembly is easy.

Tickets are $12 per lantern, and all materials are provided. This is a great project for one person, or a child + adult. Kids must be accompanied by an adult at all times.

Workshops are hosted at Sandy Springs Performing Arts Center (1 Galambos Way, Sandy Springs GA):

ðŸ– Saturday, March 29 at 11:00 AM

ðŸ– Saturday, March 29 at 3:00 PM

ðŸ· Sunday, March 30 at 3:00 PM

 

 

About the Artist 

This workshop is with lantern parade artist, Chantelle Rytter, creator of the Sandy Springs Lantern Parade, and proud Captain of the Krewe of the Grateful Gluttons. Chantelle has created a family of annual lantern parades based in community participation over the last 14 years in Sandy Springs, Midtown, Hapeville, and Hilton Head Island. Chantelle grew up in Baltimore and studied integrative arts at Penn State University. She lived in New Orleans for 10 years and fell under the spell of parade culture and the notion that creative play can be a civic gift. See more of their parades and lantern-making ideas at www.weirdgonepro.com

item.title: Songs from the Heart with Ryan Davis
item.description: Crooner Ryan Davis brings his big band The Rendezvous to Byers Theatre for a swinginâ€™ Valentineâ€™s Day treat for all the hopeful romantics! Hear romantic big-band classics like â€œFly Me to the Moon,â€ â€œThe Way You Look Tonight,â€ â€œYou Make Me Feel So Young,â€ and â€œGet Me to the Church on Time.â€ Ryan Davis grew up as part of a professional musical family. His parents, older siblings and extended family were always performing, recording and touring; his exceptional talent made him an instant success as the lead vocalist for the familyâ€™s various musical projects, where he also learned arranging, audio engineering, and recording skills. Whether performing with a 20-piece big band or in smaller combos, he continues to achieve critical and popular success with his concert performances.

item.title: Sandwich Blast Off
item.description: Taste the best Sandwiches in Sandy Springs and help choose the winner!

item.title: I-285 Express Lanes Transit Public Meetings
item.description:
MARTA is conducting a planning study to improve and optimize connectivity in the Atlanta region by leveraging the proposed Georgia Department of Transportation (GDOT) I-285 express lanes projects between the I-20 interchanges, as part of GDOT's Major Mobility Investment Program (MMIP). The I-285 Express Lanes, currently advancing within the GDOT Express Lanes program, will add two new, barrier-separated express lanes in both directions of the northern portion of I-285, alongside the existing general-purpose lanes.

  • Wednesday, Dec. 4, 2024 5:30 p.m. â€“ 7:30 p.m.
    Smyrna Community Center 1250 Powder Springs St., Smyrna, GA 30080
  • Thursday, Dec. 5, 2024 11 a.m. â€“ 1 p.m.
    Hampton Inn Perimeter Center 769 Hammond Dr. NE, Sandy Springs.  GA 30328
  • Thursday, Dec. 5, 2024 5:30 p.m. â€“ 7:30 p.m.
    Clarkston Community Center 3701 College Ave., Clarkston, GA 30021

Information: Public Meeting â€” I-285 Express Lanes Transit Study

item.title: 2025 Mayor and City Council Retreat
item.description:
City Council meetings are livestreamed on the Sandy Springs Public Meeting Website.

Agendas and minutes for this and other public meetings can also be found on the Sandy Springs Public Meeting Website, when available.

item.title: Holiday Hoops Challenge
item.description:
HOLIDAY HOOPS 2 ON 2 BASKETBALL SKILLS CHALLENGE!

AGES: 6th-8th grades; Boys & Girls
COST: FREE, includes tournament T-shirt, prizes for the winner of each contest
DATE/TIMES: Friday, Dec. 6, 2024, Check-in at 5:30PM; Competition begins at 6PM
LOCATION: Sandy Springs Middle School Gym

Girls 2 on 2 round robin tournament, free-throw, and 3-point shooting contest.

Boys 2-on-2 round robin tournament

Free-throw, and 3-point shooting contest are Coed


For more information contact Hunter Jordan@ hjordan@sandyspringsga.gov

item.title: Hoops at Hammond 3v3 Basketball Tournament
item.description:
Hoops at Hammond

3v3 Basketball Tournament

Presented by JAM Sports

Saturday, December 14th

Register Now!

  • Ages 18+
  • 2 Divisions: Coed Recreational & Coed Intermediate
  • 4 game guarantee
  • All games officiated
  • Max roster size: 5 players
  • Games begin at 11:00 AM
  • Hammond Park: 705 Hammond Drive Sandy Springs, GA 30328

 

For more info and to register, visit:

item.title: Daddy Daughter Dance - Employee Discount
item.description:
Mark your calendars for the most enchanting night of the year at the Sandy Springs Recreation and Parks 15th Annual Daddy Daughter Dance! 

This beloved event is back and even better, with two nights to choose from: Saturday, January 25, 2025, and Friday, January 31, 2025, both from 6 PM to 8 p.m. Join us on the third floor of Sandy Springs City Hall, located at 1 Galambos Way, Sandy Springs, GA.

Get ready to dance the night away with music from a live DJ featuring both dads' and daughters' favorite tunes! Enjoy a variety of fun activities, including dance contests, musical games, and delicious snacks and refreshments. Capture the magic of the evening with a keepsake photo, and donâ€™t miss out on a special goody bag for each girl. The dress code is business casual to semi-formal, so get ready to shine! 

Tickets are $40 per Daddy-Daughter duo, $10 for each additional daughter. 

Employee Discount: 

Email recreation@sandyspringsga.gov for 50% off for Daddy Daughter Tickets to ensure your account is marked as a City Employee.

 

** This is a combo ticket for one Father Figure and one Daughter** Please purchase the Additional Daughter Tickets as needed. If you have any questions, please email recreation@sandyspringsga.gov . 

**Pre-Registration Only! There will be no Tickets sold at the door.

Daughters Ages: Kindergarten through 5th Grade

Important Registration Note: Please register for only one night, as tickets are not transferable between the two events.

Donâ€™t waitâ€”register now! Tickets sell out quickly, and they will not be available at the door.

 Make unforgettable memories at the Daddy Daughter Dance! We canâ€™t wait to see you there!
